pageContext.claim: “We've come so -- you know, we've created $11.7 trillion.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump gives himself full credit for the stock boom, though his numbers were out of date. About $3.3 trillion of wealth had been wiped out by the October stock market plunge, based on the Wilshire 5000 Index, a widely used metric.Stock market wealth had grown about $4 trillion from his election to the date of this rally. Market capitalization of the top U.S. companies is not necessarily an indicator of wealth gains for the general population.
